thread.title: Twitter reacts to UCLA's NCAA tourney exit
thread.title_full: Twitter reacts to UCLA's NCAA tourney exit

author: USA TODAY
title: Twitter reacts to UCLA's NCAA tourney exit
text:
Twitter reacts to UCLA's NCAA tourney exit Welp. Twitter reacts to UCLA's NCAA tourney exit Welp.  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/03/ucla-bruins-loss-ncaa-touranment-twitter-march-madness-reaction-social-media-ball     Twitter reacts to UCLA's NCAA tourney exit Alysha Tsuji , USA TODAY 12:40 a.m. ET March 25, 2017 
UCLA lost to Kentucky , 86-75, on Friday night, so the Bruins' NCAA tournament run ends in the Sweet 16. And freshman Lonzo Ball announced that this was his last college basketball game right afterwards. 
Kentucky freshmen De'Aaron Fox and Malik Monk led the way for the Wildcats with 39 and 21 points, respectively. Next, Kentucky will face North Carolina in the Elite Eight on Sunday. 
For now, though, Twitter reacted exactly as you thought it would: We're gonna need a separate Twitter just for LaVar Ball shade tweets — Seth Davis (@SethDavisHoops) March 25, 2017 "If I was coaching we would have beat Kentucky." - LaVar Ball pic.twitter.com/sUhOl6oPdI — Bryce Wood (@woodymlb4) March 25, 2017 Um, Mr. Lavar Bell..i DID try and tell ya. I most certainly did. You cut checks your son couldn't cash. I did warn you sir. I really did. — Stephen A Smith (@stephenasmith) March 25, 2017 Ball Did Lie. (LaVar, that is)
